Each vehicle has a <capacity> unit limit and must complete deliveries within a 12-hour window (<duration_limit>). Evacuation sites require supplies by specific deadlines (<time_window>), and routes must terminate at the last delivery point without returning to depots, ensuring equitable resource allocation across disaster zones.

title: Solar Panel Maintenance Across Remote Sites
content: A solar energy company operates multiple regional depots (<loc_depot>) to service remote solar farms (<loc_customer>). Each maintenance truck has a limited capacity (<capacity>) for carrying replacement panels and tools. Technicians must complete repairs within a customer-specified maintenance window (<time_windows>) to avoid disrupting energy production. Additionally, each vehicle’s route must not exceed an 8-hour working day (<time_limit>), and routes terminate at the final site (no return to depot). The goal is to minimize total travel distance while adhering to capacity, time windows, and duration constraints.

title: Satellite Dish Installation for Rural Broadband Expansion
content: A telecommunications firm deploys teams from distributed depots (<loc_depot>) to install satellite dishes (<loc_customer>) in rural areas. Each installation van can carry a maximum of <capacity> dishes and tools. Installations must occur during pre-approved time windows (<time_windows>) when residents are available. Crews cannot work beyond a 10-hour shift (<time_limit>), and routes end at the last installation site. The challenge is to optimize vehicle assignments and routes to minimize travel costs while meeting all constraints.

title: Emergency Medical Supply Distribution During Pandemic Outbreaks
content: Health authorities coordinate with multiple regional warehouses (<loc_depot>) to rush critical supplies (<demand>) to overwhelmed hospitals (<loc_customer>). Drivers must complete their routes within a 12-hour window (<time_limit>) to avoid fatigue. Routes terminate at the final hospital, ensuring no unnecessary return trips. The objective is to prioritize high-risk areas while minimizing total travel distance.

title: Perishable Flower Export Logistics with Airport Time Constraints
content: A flower exporter operates from several regional hubs (<loc_depot>) to transport fragile blooms (<demand>) to international airports (<loc_customer>). Refrigerated trucks have a capacity limit (<capacity>), and exports must reach airports within strict time windows (<time_windows>) to avoid spoilage. Drivers cannot exceed an 18-hour journey (<time_limit>), and routes end at the airport (no return to the hub). The goal is to optimize routes to minimize fuel costs while ensuring all shipments arrive fresh and on time.

title: Airport Ground Crew Coordination for Flight Turnaround Scheduling
content: An airport’s ground operations team manages baggage handling crews from multiple depots (<loc_depot>) assigned to aircraft at different terminals (<loc_customer>). Each baggage cart has a limited capacity (<capacity>), and crews must complete loading/unloading within flight turnaround time windows (<time_windows>). Crew shifts are capped at 10 hours (<time_limit>), and routes end at the final gate. The task is to coordinate routes to minimize passenger delays while adhering to capacity and time constraints.

title: Offshore Supply Vessel Logistics
content: An oil company operates multiple coastal supply depots (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver equipment and provisions to offshore drilling platforms (`<loc_customer>`). Routes must originate from the nearest depot, respect platform-specific time windows for crane availability, and avoid returning vessels to port until all scheduled stops are complete.

title: Urban Emergency Ambulance Routing

content: A global tech firm requires technicians to service overheating cooling units at scattered data centers (`<loc_customer>`) using regional maintenance hubs (`<loc_depot>`). title: Wind Turbine Technician Deployment
content: A renewable energy firm dispatches technicians from service bases (`<loc_depot>`) to inspect offshore wind turbines (`<loc_customer>`). title: Coastal Cleanup Operations with Tidal and Capacity Constraints
content: Coastal cleanup crews operate from multiple regional depots (<loc_depot>) to collect marine debris from scattered beaches and harbors (<loc_customer>). Each cleanup site requires a specific effort level (<demand>), and the work must occur during tidal windows (<time_windows>) when water levels expose debris. Cleanup boats have limited capacity (<capacity>) for hauling waste, and crews must complete their routes within shift durations (<time_limit>) to avoid overtime. Routes begin at a depot, service sites within tidal windows, and end at disposal sites without returning. The goal is to maximize cleanup coverage while respecting operational constraints.

Routes start from a depot, proceed to the rescue site, and end there to establish a base, avoiding unnecessary return trips.

title: Urban Food Bank Distribution with Perishable Goods and Time Sensitive Donations

title: Airport Shuttle Services for International Conventions
content: Multiple airports (<loc_depot>) operate shuttle buses to transport delegates to a central convention center. Each bus has a capacity limit (<capacity>) to accommodate passengers. title: Hospital Blood Sample Collection Network

Vans follow open routes, ending at the originating hospital after the final pickup. The goal is to optimize routes to meet all time constraints while avoiding overloading vehicles.
